lines.text: Hey, whatta you know? I'm a flying object lesson.

[after Hugo tries to rock and cuddle him the way he did with Bugs]
Desist! Release me at once! I am not now nor have I ever been a robot!
Not a robot, George? Then I shall have to punish you good.
Trouble with this world is that everybody's out to get everybody else. I mean, why can't people be more like me? I love everybody.
Oh, how simply dandy. I've captured another Earth creature. Why, isn't that lovely? Hugo will be so happy to have a playmate, but you know how lonesome he gets.
I will hug him, and stroke him, and cuddle him, and sing to him, and call him George, duh.
Well, you know, uh, how do you like it?

[holding up his wrist so Bugs can see his watch, which happens to have Marvin on it]
Oh George, I'm so happy, I'm the first kid on my block to have a Mickey Martian watch.
I wonder, are you any good at throwing frisbee disks?
Oh, yes, George. I'm the best Frisbee-disk-thrower on my block.

[pointing to Earth]
You see that little planet over there? You think you can hit it from here?

[taking the flying saucer]
Oh, yes, George. That's easy as pie.

[after landing his saucer on Mars and carrying the sleeping Bugs out]
Oh, I can hardly wait till Hugo finds him. Hugo will be so thrilled, he will probably smother him with love.

[rocking Bugs and singing]
Bye-baby-bunting, Daddy's gone a hunting to get a little baby skin to wrap the baby rabbit in.
